/** * Definition for singly-linked list. * struct ListNode { *     int val; *     ListNode *next; *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {} * }; */class Solution {public:    ListNode* merge(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {        ListNode* L = new ListNode(0);        ListNode* i = L;        while (l1 && l2) {            if (l1->val < l2->val) {                i->next = l1;                l1 = l1->next;                i = i->next;            } else {                i->next = l2;                l2 = l2->next;                i = i->next;            }        }        while (l1) {            i->next = l1;            l1 = l1->next;            i = i->next;        }        while (l2) {            i->next = l2;            l2 = l2->next;            i = i->next;        }        L = L->next;        return L;    }};

#include <iostream>using namespace std;int main() {    int a[110][110] = {0};    int n, m;    scanf("%d%d", &n, &m);    int dx[] = {0, 1, 0, -1}, dy[] = {1, 0, -1, 0};    for (int i = 0, j = 0, d = 0, s = 1; s <= n * m; s ++ ) {        a[i][j] = s;        int x = i + dx[d], y = j + dy[d];        if (x < 0 || x >= n || y < 0 || y >= m || a[x][y]) {            d = (d + 1) % 4;            x = i + dx[d], y = j + dy[d];        }        i = x, j = y;    }    for (int i = 0; i < n; i ++ ) {        for (int j = 0; j < m; j ++ )            printf("%d ", a[i][j]);        printf("\n");    }    return 0;}

/** * Definition for singly-linked list. * struct ListNode { *     int val; *     ListNode *next; *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {} * }; */class Solution {public:    ListNode *findFirstCommonNode(ListNode *headA, ListNode *headB) {        ListNode* p = headA;        ListNode* q = headB;        while (p != q) {            if (p) p = p->next;            else p = headB;            if (q) q = q->next;            else q = headA;        }        return p;    }};
